question: What is the difference between Authentication & Authorization?
answer: Authentication is the process of verification or identification. It identifies or verifies person or users depending on user credentials. It allows a person or a user to enter into the application or any other protected environment. After authentication, authorization determines the level of functionalities or access the person or user can do. This level is not set by the user or person, rather it is set by the authority of the application or environment. So, authorization comes after authentication.

question: Why firebase? What's the other alternatives?
answer: Firebase is a google product, we can trust the quality, security & maintenance of firebase. It provides authentication which offers almost complete identity solution which support email password auth, phone no auth, Google, Facebook, GitHub, Twitter and more on which also included some good free services. There are also many good alternative to google firebase. Some open source firebase alternatives are Parse, AWS Amplify, Flutter, RxDB, Back4App, BackEndLess, Kuzzle etc which provides free and paid services similar to Google Firebase.

question: What other services does firebase provide other than authentication?
answer: Authentication is a part of services provided by Firebase. There are lot of interesting feature that firebase provide. Like, with firebase, we can test new feature of our app withing group of user first, track the result in analytics. So it helps to reduce the risk of launching new features. With help of real time database, it let's user to chat with each other without leaving the app which is called cloud messaging. Some features provided by Firebase are reporting, analytics, activity dashboard, hosting, real time database, cloud database (Firestore), storage, machine learning, cloud messaging etc. Firebase also made app development a lot easier.
